instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1398: What is A1398? A1398 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2015, Mid 2012, Early 2013, Late 2013, Mid 2014 with EMC 2909, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00138, 820-00163, 820-00426, 820-3332, 820-3662, 820-3787..
definitions.820-3663: What is 820-3663? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3662: What is 820-3662? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermitten shut down, video pixelation.ran ASD got code PPM003
threads.message:
hi guys,
Im working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board, it's experiencing intermittent shut down while the laptop is being used. sometimes the graphics will get pixelated before that.
I ran the ASD and it says reference code PPM002"there may be an issue with a memory module. additional reference code:ppm003

not sure where to start, the GPU, PCH,CPU ,are all integrated into one chipset on board. wouldn't want to touch them

Im doubting on the memory module on the board. thinking to reflow them. just trying to see if any one got similar cases before and have successful repair experience on it.

(I don't want to mess around since there are so many modules on the board)

thanks!

(sorry typo in the title,should be <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3662</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>)

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermitten shut down, video pixelation.ran ASD got code PPM003
threads.message: RAM or CPU or bad solder. Reflowing will probably just mask the problem. Best in these cases is to replace all RAM chips to be sure. Certainly a bottom of the pile board for me!

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermitten shut down, video pixelation.ran ASD got code PPM003
threads.message: Lol, I do doubt the ram chips, but there are just too many to reball and replace. damn I will try ,thanks DUKE

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1398</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3663</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> intermitten shut down, video pixelation.ran ASD got code PPM003
threads.message: Reball? Get NEW chips of course.

threads.message: um..where do I get the NEW ones?I mean the real new ones....
